name: More Things You May Have Wondered About Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Simon Legree' is synonymous with cold-heartedness. Where does this character come from?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Tom's Cabin.

	Harriet Beecher Stowe

questions.text: Which is not one of the Seven Deadly Sins?
questions.explanation:
Dishonesty.

	How did this not make the list?

questions.text: In Poe's 'Raven', the bird ends up sitting 'on the pallid bust of Pallas'. Who is Pallas?
questions.explanation:
Athena.

	Sometimes referred to as 'Pallas Athena'.

questions.text: Along with Alcatraz, Sing Sing was one of the most famous prisons in the U.S. Where was it located?
'Freudian Slips' are more technically known as
questions.explanation:
Parapraxes.

	'Freudian slips' doesn't sound like a scientific term.

questions.text: One of Richard Wagner's works is about 'the Valkyries'. Who are they?
questions.correct: Mythological warrior maidens who carry the slain to Valhalla
options: Mythological monsters that must be slain
Mythological guardians of vast wealth and treasure
questions.explanation:
Mythological warrior maidens who carry the slain to Valhalla.

	Norse mythology.

questions.text: 'The Black Hole of Calcutta' is an infamous example of inhuman conditions. When did this incident occur?
questions.explanation:
18th century.

	Mid-century, prior to the outbreak of the Seven Years (French and Indian War).

questions.text: 'Hobson's Choice' is no choice at all. Where did the term originate?
questions.explanation:
A livery stable.

	You could have any horse - as long as it was the one next to the door.

questions.text: Murphy's Law has come to mean that the worst possible event will always happen. Who was Murphy?
Longfellow immortalized 'Hiawatha' in an epic poem. To what tribe did the real Hiawatha belong?
questions.explanation:
Iroquois.

	Hiawatha was apparently a key figure in uniting the Indians of the 'Five Nations' into the Iroquois Confederacy In New York and surrounding areas). The other Indians mentioned are all Western.
